title: Jorge Masvidal vs Nate Diaz fight back on at UFC 244
text:
UFC boss Dana White has confirmed that Jorge Masvidal against Nate Diaz at UFC 244 will go ahead after the fight was recently called into question.

Diaz sensationally pulled out of the clash on Thursday after posting a statement saying he had tested positive for 'elevated levels' of 'tainted supplements'.

However, the fight now seems to be back on, with White posting the fight's poster on to social media along with the caption 'I 100 per cent knew Nate wasn't taking anything to cheat.'

Nate Diaz has said that he has falsely tested positive for 'elevated levels' of a substance

The fighter has been cleared by USADA, and the fight will go ahead after some doubts

The fight is ON!!! I 100% knew Nate wasn't taking anything to cheat. #UFC244 November 2, MSG. #BMF pic.twitter.com/U9VEOPT0Ul — Dana White (@danawhite) October 26, 2019

USADA, the United States anti-doping body, has now cleared Diaz so he is eligible to compete at the event. UFC released a statement saying: 'On October 24, 2019, Nate Diaz released a public statement regarding a recent out-of-competition test conducted by USADA.

'UFC has been notified by USADA that the out-of-competition test concluded that LGD-4033 was present in Mr. Diaz’s sample at an amount below the decision concentration level for this substance.

'USADA is reviewing the out-of-competition test as an atypical finding. Further laboratory testing conducted by the Sports Medicine Research and Testing Laboratory (SMRTL), a WADA-accredited lab in Salt Lake City, Utah, has confirmed that two bottles of the same organic, vegan, plant-based daily multivitamin that Mr. Diaz was using were each contaminated with LGD-4033, which the evidence supports resulted in Mr. Diaz’s positive sample.

'Mr. Diaz has not committed an anti-doping policy violation, has not been provisionally suspended and is not subject to any sanctions.

UFC President Dana White has confirmed the fight in New York will go ahead as planned

'Additionally, UFC has been informed by independent experts who have determined that there is unequivocally no appreciable performance enhancing or therapeutic benefit from the significantly limited amount of LGD-4033 that may be present in his system, which is roughly 10,000 times lower than one LGD-4033 therapeutic dose.'

The fight for the new 'Baddest Motherf****r Belt' will take place as planned on November 2 at Madison Square Garden in New York.

Diaz, who was apparently asked to stay quiet about his drug test results, tweeted out a heated statement on Thursday when he thought he would not be able to compete.

'I'm not gonna make it out to NYC for fight week next week because they say I tested with elevated levels that they say might be from some tainted supplements,' he said.

'I call false on that cause I only take Whole Food or natural supplements. I don't even eat meat.

'So until UFC, USADA or whoever is F*****G with me fixes it, I won't be competing.'

Diaz took to Twitter to tell his fans the news over the failed test and that he won't compete

He also hit out at advice given to remain silent on the test results, saying he is not a 'cheater'

The Stockton-born fighter made reference to other fighters who have tested positive in the past but still gone on to fight, saying doing so would be cheating.

'I'm not gonna play their game and try and hide it or keep quiet, as they suggested. I'm not gonna have my name tainted as a cheater like these other motherf***ers who keep quiet until after the fight just so they can get paid. F*****g cheaters.

'I don't give a f*** about some money over my dignity and my legacy. I'm not playing along with this b*******.

'I'm not staying quiet and figuring it out after the fight. That's cheating. So fight game I'll see you when I see you. Sincerely, the realest baddest mother f***er in the game.'
description: The fight now seems to be back on, with UFC chief Dana White posting the fight's poster to social media along with the caption 'I 100% knew Nate wasn't taking anything to cheat.'
